Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: J J
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located very near to St Marks, we received a detailed email from the hotel with clear directions on how to find it so it was very easy. The room was great and detailed with Venetian style, rooms were clean and bathroom was very nice (albeit a bit difficult to get in and out of the shower/bath due to a strange layout) Breakfast was good, simple with pastries, coffee, bread. The staff were very friendly and helpful - lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay thanks to Relais and it's warm friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: darren p
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, celebrating her 40th birthday, could not have chosen a better hotel for our stay. Our room, 303, with views over the roof tops of Venice and St Marks tower, seen through it's Velux electronic opening window was delightful. Mucho aromantica! All the staff were very friendly and amazingly helpful. The information they provided was priceless, from timetables, routes and handy tips. They confirmed a booking for us at the marvelous Musica Palazzo and the directions for everything was first class. Finding the hotel was easy, 5mins from St Marks square. I would highly recommend this small, friendly, elegant, convenient hotel. Thanks to everyone at Relais Venezia

Reviews.Title: “For sure would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: litigator_br
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife went to Italy in September/2011. In Venice we stayed at the Relais Venezia hotel. I recommend. Good hotel, clean rooms, good breakfast and very very well located. It is very close to Piazza San Marco. We arrived by train and get out by plane. The two courses was easily done, even with large suitcases, except for the stairs of Venice bridges. The hotel staff is very attentive and polite. The hotel is not big (about 10 rooms), so they encourage customers to eat the breakfast in the room for free. This thing makes the trip more romantic.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: joesob
Reviews.Content: minutes from st mark's square, the location can't be beat. yes, it is down a small street off the beaten path, but for me that was part of the charm. the hotel's website's directions were spot on for us, and after a day it was actually very easy to find. service was very good, and very helpful. the breakfast was very simple; nothing fancy, but sufficient for starting the day. please note that the rooms vary quite a bit, however, and the overall experience at the hotel varies depending on your room. my buddy with whom i was travelling had a large room on the top floor with a great view. my room was behind the reception desk, had a small bathroom, and only one window with a view of the airshaft between buidlings. and we both paid the exact same price. ah, the luck of the draw... so, overall we were happy with the hotel. it was a great value, given its location and the low price that we got. but do be forewarned that not all rooms are equal, though their prices may be.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Saud A
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is ranked as a 3 stars hotel, I couldn't feel it was less than 4s. The location is excellent; only few minutes from St.Mark's Square. Service was excellent, room and bathroom were clean, breakfast buffet was simple but nice and staff was friendly. Don't bother if you find it hard finding its location; I used my GPS to locate it but it wasn't a negative. I would recommend this hotel definitely.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: HalGail
Reviews.Content: The Relais Venezia is truly a gem of the boutique hotels. Located within a 5 minute walk of St. Mark's Square, this hotel is wonderfully located and has been tastefully remodeled in the past couple of years. Its location puts it in the middle of all the great Venetian activities yet it is just removed enough to provide you with the peace and solitude that you may want after a long day of Venetian sight seeing, shopping and restauranting! The hotel was impeccable, the rooms large and comfortable, the staff could not do enough for us. We were a party of 5 with 3 rooms and saw both double and single rooms. A beautiful breakfast was laid every morning with made to order cappucino, espresso, Cafe Americano and it was great coffee!! The staff was able to answer any question we posed regarding major locales in Venice and most of the time was able to give us specific direction as to how to get there. They shared with us some of the little Venetian secrets that most tourists never find out about - places for great wine tasting, restaurants where no one speaks anything but Italian and the food was to die for. It was as if you had known each member of the staff for many years. You were treated as a family member; not as a guest who would never be seen again. We hope to visit Venice again in 2013 and would not stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Good but hard-to-find location”
Reviews.Author: HappyGoLuckyNJ
Reviews.Content: Definitely have a GOOD map in hand when trying to find the hotel or ask the receptionist ahead of time for directions to the hotel from St. Mark's Square. This boutique hotel is definitely modern and clean with a very neat design aesthetic. We stayed in the "white room" and it was the nicest room we stayed in on our journey. Because the room looks out onto a dark, grungy alleyway, we decided to keep the windows closed to prevent any mosquitoes from coming in. FYI, when the windows are closed (and the lights are out), the room gets pitch dark. It's like sleeping in a tomb, so consequently we slept well! Plus, the "white room" is between floors 1 and 2, so you don't have any neighbors on either side and there's no need to worry about thin walls. There's a laundromat about 2 minutes away that we found easily thanks to directions from our front desk receptionist. Our breakfasts were the most basic ones we had in our travels, but that's Venice for you (i.e. the dollar gets you very little in this extremely expensive city). The hotel was very clean and the bathroom was easy to maneuver in, even considering the typical small sizes in Europe. We were about a 2 minute walk from St. Mark's square, so we were close to the action with half the price-tag. There was also free wi-fi we could use in the rooms and it worked well. There is an elevator in the hotel, which apparently is uncommon in this old city, so it's handicap accessible. Lastly, there's a pharmacy nearby on the way to the laundromat. TIP #1: The front door to the hotel is a clear glass sliding door with an electronic keypad. Your room key opens it but when first arriving to the hotel, simply ring the doorbell and the receptionist (located on the 2nd floor) will open the door for you. Walk up the 2 flights of stairs to the receptionist's desk. Odd layout that might confuse some. TIP #2: If you pay in cash (i.e. not with a credit card), they'll give you a discount. Had we known this in advance, we would've paid cash.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Location, Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravelersVR
Reviews.Content: We stayed here inbetween Christmas and New Year and really enjoyed our stay. It is a very nice boutique-style hotel, in a great location just round the corner from St. Marks Square. The room was a good size with a view over the roof tops towards St Marks Square. It was clean, good value for the money but the breakfast was a bit basic and when served in our room (which was recomended to us on arrival) we had even less choice. The concierge at the hotel was friendly, very helpful and offered a good discount for paying in cash. The only issue for us was that the WiFi didnt reach our room so we had to use the reception area to access the internet. I would definately recomend this time of year to visit as it is very quiet and romantic.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again and again”
Reviews.Author: Sulu32
Reviews.Content: I booked a reservation at Relais Venezia after several days of research. Arriving at the train station in the early afternoon, we took the vaporetto from the train station to St. Mark's only to find that the square was flooded (a temporary condition in the middle of the day) so we had to change our planned route to the hotel. It's embarrasing to admit, but we found it a bit tough to find the hotel the first time - mainly due to the unplanned detour. When we arrived, we were immediately impressed by the hotel and the very friendly and attentive staff. We were assigned a room just off the lobby and front desk area, but we had no issue with noise whatsoever. Our room, bed and bath were lovely. The room was very well decorated and that made our stay in Venice feel even more special. As others have said, the location of this hotel is almost perfect if you want to walk to the main attractions of the city. The only reason I didn't give an excellent rating is due to the lack of selection at free breakfast which was a bit disappointing compared with the rest of the experience. Everything considered, we were very happy with our stay at the Relais Venizia and recommend this hotel to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: slfrenchca
Reviews.Content: Relais Venezia was a nice, boutique hotel. It was clean and comfortable. The bathrooms appeared to be very recently updated with big, spa tubs and marble. The staff was very helpful. The only complaint was that the breakfast was served either in the hotel lobby or in your room and it was quite awkward. They also didn't have many options for gluten-free breakfast although were very willing to help. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: chitown123
Reviews.Content: Pros Location- not too far from St. Marks Room- good sized room Management- gave us great suggestions for local restaurants, & offered us free room service for breakfast because my wife was on crutches Food- breakfast had a good variety Value- with its location, free breakfast, & accommodating staff- the price was very reasonable Cons Location â€“ can be hard to find. It is down a side street, MAKE SURE YOU PRINT OUT THE MAP, otherwise it easy to walk past it or get lost Beds â€“ were not the most comfortable, but most the beds in the places we stayed in Europe tended to be that way Overall it was a great place to stay, & I would recommend it very highly. I would give 4 1/2 out of 5 if that was an option

Reviews.Title: “Not inexpensive but very good!”
Reviews.Author: jbltd
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at the hotel Relais Venezia and enjoyed every minute. From the moment I received the instructions on how to find the place - you must follow them carefully - I felt a degree of care. This continued as I checked in, to be greeted by a charming host who gave me a map at once, circled important places and several restaurants that were worth finding, and showed me to my room. Every day I was impressd by the personal approach the hotel takes. It is not large only 10 rooms but mine was huge, with a lovely bathroom. The recent renovations and upgrading to the property are excellent. Breakfast is served in the foyer and works wonderfully well. The selection is typical of an Italian continental but the quality was good. The location is amazing- within 5 minutes walk of St Marks Square but you feel so distant from the throngs in the quiet calle across a delightful canal bridge. All amenities are close at hand and the mini-bar fridge is useful to keep water and foods for picnics cold. I thought is was simply terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Benjybooboo
Reviews.Content: We chose this small and intimate hotel for our stay in Venice for our 25th wedding anniversary and we weren't disappointed. The room was quiet, spotlessly clean, had a very comfortable bed and a large modern bathroom. Breakfast is continental style - good, but fresh fruit would have been nice to have. You can either have breakfast in the small area next to reception or in your room free of charge. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, especially informative in regards to where to go, what to see and how to get there. The hotels location in between St Mark's Square and the Rialto bridge was ideal for exploring Venice. Lots of shops and restaurants nearby - including a small supermarket for stocking up on soft drinks and water (small fridge in room). Would definitely recommend this hotel and would certainly stay there again on a future trip to Venice (and we loved our first time in Venice so we will be back one day).

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, bad ending!”
Reviews.Author: Kyle5599
Reviews.Content: Let me just start by saying that my wife and I really loved this hotel. It was in a great location, only 2 minutes from St. Mark's Square, the room was really nice; it had a big bed, fridge, safe, flat screen TV and a really nice bathroom. It's pretty much everything you could hope to find in Venice at a very good price. The only reason I couldn't give this hotel a 5 out of 5 is because of what happened at checkout. When we had checked in and signed everything and turned our passports in, the guy at the counter said "you don't need to pay now, you pay with cash when you checkout". Well when he said it I heard him say the word cash, but I assumed it was kind of lost in translation and he just meant you had to pay when you checked out, which is what we had done at the hotel we had stayed at in Tuscany. But when we checked out, it was truly cash only, which I'm sorry, that is totally unacceptable for a nice hotel. Nobody wants to be carrying tons of cash on them when travelling in Europe because of pickpockets and to have to turn over 400 euros to pay for the hotel kind of sucked. It was at the end of our stay in Italy and I had to sprint down to St. Mark's Square and find an ATM to get more cash out and sprint back so we could make it to the train. But other than that I would absolutely recommend this hotel, the staff was great to us, the breakfast was pretty good, and like I said, the room is everything you could hope for in Venice. If you decide to stay at the Relais Victoria I guarantee you will like it, just make sure if you are staying less than 3 nights there you bring plenty of cash! Thanks for reading.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: tonyeggo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Relais In July 2010 and we found it to be a perfect hotel. The staff were very helpful, the location is right in the middle of the Rialto bridge and San Marco square and the value for money was amazing. I wouldn't hesitate in recommending this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: doc_sk
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, romantic rooms especially bathroom, very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but good value in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: turgonuk
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights early April. Pros: Excellent location, very handy for San Marco, Rialto etc. Very clean rooms and kept that way daily. English speaking staff, mostly helpful. Elevator to lobby for bags. Very quiet at night for sleep. Excellent modern bathroom. Comfy bed. Decent size room with enough closet space for most people. Fridge in closet (min bar) Cons: WiFi did not work, as they were not computer experts they could not fix this. One English channel on the TV (BBC W) kept breaking up and failing. Breakfast basic and had to eat it in cramped lobby (or room) Zero view from room (a wall) with very little natural daylight. Hard pillows Basic furnishings, e.g. no bedside lights etc. Overall I would recommend this on location, value and pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “It made our honeymoon very special”
Reviews.Author: kostasglasgow
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel with great staff. Very polite and helpful and they went the extra mile to make our honeymoon special we will always cherish the time we spent in Relais Venezia and beautiful Venice

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and helpful, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Jbd36
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, close to St Marks Square, so easy to find and not far from any of the sites. Perfect for a weekend or short stay visit. A continental breakfast is provided which was great for giving our ever hungry teenagers a good start for the day. The staff were very helpful and friendly, giving us genuinely good advice on how to make the best of the ferry tickets and which restaurants to try, or more importantly to avoid! Rooms a good size and competitively priced. We will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel in an ideal central location, with excellent personal service. Made our stay thoroughly enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: travel_bug786
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Relais Venezia during our trip to Venice in mid-January 2011. The hotel was a bit tricky to find initially but the map provided by the hotel upon confirmation of our booking, was very helpful. As soon as we got there, we checked in to our room on first floor (a lovely venetian blue theme), however we were first given a very warm introduction to Venice by the gentleman at reception. We were provided with a map of Venice by the hotel however I would recommend to get an additional street map to help you get around. We received breakfast in our room on a daily basis, which was lovely. Although would have been nice to have warm croissants but other than that it was fantastic, especially at no extra cost. The only gripe we had was the lift, which we had to use due to my husband's knee injury. You have to keep the button pressed in order to call the lift or for it to ascend/descend. But all in all, it was not a big deal. The room was cleaned daily, although the sheets were not changed during our stay. The bathroom was fabulous and kept spotless. The only english channels we found were MTV and BBC News! But luckily we got access to the free wifi so didn't miss the TV too much. Overall, the location of the hotel was spot on as was the hotel itself. If you come to Venice you would not go wrong to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “What stands out at this B&B is Crystal everywhere!!!”
Reviews.Author: RedheadCalgary
Reviews.Content: Avant-garde!! Thats the word! Breathtaking place! The owner is as avant-garde as his place! Tall,with wild hair he could be an actor from Phantom of the Opera! Fitting for Venice! But he was more than kind and gracious with information or directions for us. What stands out at this B&B is "crystal" everywhere from your bedside lamps to the lobby "Milano Crystal!" Spectacular place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully plush find in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: WoodyfromCalgary
Reviews.Content: Like ALL Venice addresses, its a bit tricky to find this hotel, however, it's well worth the search. Located on the 2nd floor of an historical building, this hotel is like an oasis. I've stayed in other centrally-located hotels in Venice, but this one was in a category of its own. The interior decor was exquisite with marble and flowing oversized blue drapery. The bathroom - with granite and marble treatment - was so impressive I even took a picture of it! (Who ever takes a picture of a bathroom?). The staff were friendly and extremely accomodating. Truly a 5-star gem, yet with a reasonable price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, Spacious Room”
Reviews.Author: madabouticecream
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 'white' room for 3 nights and it was beautiful. It was centrally located to all of the major sites and very quiet. The room was large and confortable but the bathroom was quite tiny given the size of the bedroom. We enjoyed having a little bar fridge available for our drinks (supermarket around the corner) and the luxury of having our breakfast (included in the price) delivered to our room, rather than having to have it served in the lobby. The owner was very nice when we arrived and gave us a full overview of Venice and where to walk and visit (and areas to avoid!). The airconditioner broke on the first night due to the late August heat, but it was fixed the next morning. The accommodation was a little pricey but given the research we did before arriving, we were prepared to pay a little more for a room that had the space and was luxurious. We did save 10% by paying cash. Overall, a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Super bijou hotel in the perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: webgemcanada
Reviews.Content: Finding the hotel was difficult as we were expecting a grander entrance and water taxi access. We arrived at high tide with an onshore wind and St. Marks Square flooded so the bridges were not high enough for taxis to get under. The hotel is known to taxis and Gondoliers and is at the canal end of Cassellaria. We arrived in good shape and found the hotel. What a jewel. Spartan but nevertheless a jewell. The staff were more than accomodating and full of helpful tips. This hotel is a small hideaway in Venice midway between St. Marks Square and the Rialto Bridge within five minutes stroll from each. Tastefully renovated with silken draperies, exposed 17th century beams and Murano lighting fixtures, the overall impression of the hotel was really good and it's proximity to many inexpensive eateries was convenient. We were even given a Murano glass rememberance of a restaurant close by at the end of our meal. Beer is more expensive than wine in Venice so go without your Bud Light and go for a good Merlot instead. If we return to Venice, this is where we'll stay, if they will have room for us. The elevator only goes up to the lobby from street level and I believe I counted 53 white marble steps between the lobby and our top floor room. The top floor gave us a view over the rooftops of Venice to the Dolomites on the horizon. Thankfully our hosts carried our 66lbs suitcases both up and down for us but we managed the climb to our room several times a day and considered it a useful cardio-vascular workout as we are in our sixties. Overall we rate this hotel highly and would reccomend it to anyone who doesn't expect or demand the Waldorf Astoria.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely small boutique hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: traveldreams08
Reviews.Content: Charming, friendly staff. They recommended restaurants, there is an excellent litlte family trattoria steps away west of the front door that serves great pizza,seafood, and cappucino. The breakfast was perfect, our room was clean and we had a small window overlooking the rooftops, we heard the church bells in the morning. We loved it, the beds were comfy, and there was extra room to spread out suitcases. A little mini-fridge for wine and what more can you ask for? The location was great, steps away from the craziness of San Marco, but so quiet and peaceful. We loved the gentle Venetian people, the woman who served breakfast and both men at the front desk were lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding advice on Where to Eat and Where to go in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Fullstop123
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Relais-Venezia- the rooms were clean, quiet, and the coffee in the morning was excellent! We also received many great tips on where to eat and some excellent places to see not were outside the main tourist attarctions. If Leonardo is managing the reception desk, please ask him for advice- he provided us with excellent local knowledge; very helpful and patience. Lenny and Gina USA

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Harwil
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Relais Venezia April 2010. We travelled with 2 adults and 2 children (15yrs and 8yrs). We stayed in the quad room on the top floor. We we very happy with the hotel. Everything about it was perfect. We have been to Venice a few times before and this place is the best!! The room was very clean, bright and sunny, overlooking the rooftops. It was wonderful to wake up and hear the bells in San Marco ringing. The location could not have been better but make sure you pay attention to the directions to find the hotel. It was a little tricky to find.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, great value”
Reviews.Author: eleanormbowen
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel right in the center of Venice, very close to the Piazza San Marco. Elegant rooms, friendly and staff and decent breakfast. My brother and I stayed here on our first few nights in Italy. We got a very good price (it was off season) and I thought we got more than our money's worth. The only downsides were the fact that internet was only available for certain hours during the day and there was not much of a view- but we spent so much time enjoying that wonderful city that it hardly mattered!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Doris168
Reviews.Content: good location and big rooms.....however, we did noticed that the bedsheet and pillow cases were not changed at all throughout our 3 night stay

Reviews.Title: “Cute little hotel in greal location”
Reviews.Author: EPWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: As others mentioned, great location. Wish they had an elevator going to the top floors since sometimes the stairs were hard to climb (they are very steep). The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was spacious (we booked a Superior room), but the bathroom was very tiny. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel to only young people (because of the stairs).

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: TravelinGreggs
Reviews.Content: Such a find! Price was great and so close to San Marco square - maybe a 5 minute stroll! The hotel is tucked away, there weren't any views to speak of from our room, but the location was fantastic. The rooms were large, clean and very modern. Staff spoke English and was helpful and friendly. There wasn't internet in the hotel which was bummer, but we didn't stay inside much anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Really pleasant little hotel in an exceptionally convenient location”
Reviews.Author: skedaddle
Reviews.Content: Really nice little hotel in an incredibly convenient location less than 5 minutes walk from Piazza San Marco. The rooms were generously sized, very clean and the hotel was very quiet. The staff were incredibly welcoming and helpful, booking water taxis, etc. Breakfast was very nice - can be taken in your room for no extra charge. Would certainly recommend this hotel to others and stay there myself if visiting Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely fantastic!!!! Highly recommended!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DilaraM
Reviews.Content: Great Location, just between San Marco and Rialto Bridge. Very clean and decorated with modern, comfortable and tasteful furnitures. Thanks for your hospitality!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sunrisecarib
Reviews.Content: OMG what can I say. We had the perfect stay here. Breakfast in the room every morning. Great rooms, comfy beds, perfect location. Brand new.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, accessible”
Reviews.Author: ansb10
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night here but loved it. Like everything in Venice, it was difficult to find but we were happy when we did. Our room was on a high floor, you take an elevator up to reception and then it was about three flights up which wasn't too bad, plus we had a view. Everything was spotlessly clean, the shower had a great rain showerhead and hairdryer (it was separate, in our closet). Once we got our bearings it was the perfect location between St. Mark's and the Rialto. The front desk person was extremely helpful with tips for getting around, and the cappucinos for breakfast were delicious. You have the option of taking breakfast in your room, which we did and were glad because the breakfast area is small and was full when we came through. If we ever go back to Venice we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great city, elegant accomodations, would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: z311rules
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were delighted with this hotel. It was a little hard to find at first, but most places in Venice are! Dario (I think), was absolutely a gem. He greeted us upon our arrival and helped carry our heavy luggage all the way to the top floor to our room for us. He also gave us a great introduction to the area and some tips on things to do, where to go, etc. from the hotel. Although his Italian accent was thick, we still could understand him and appreciated the time he took to make us feel welcome. The hotel is beautifully decorated, very elegant and classy. Our room (top 3rd floor), was up a very steep flight of steps, but we were ok with it as we're in good shape (there is one elevator you can use but the steps were quicker). Our room was beautiful as well, spacious, and a pretty good view out on the rooftops of Venice. Bathroom was nice, although I couldn't figure out the hairdryer. Also, we had a little issue with the shower not draining well, but not a huge issue (and this might just be an overall issue in Venice as the city is sinking?). Bed was big and comfy. We were surprised with a free breakfast for us the morning we had to leave...especially since we left EARLY to catch a train to our next destination. This was of course the typical European stuff - cafe, juice, croissants, etc., but perfect to get us going and off on a good note. It was a special treat. We spent most of our time out and about on the tiny streets exploring Venice, and it is a CHARMING, romantic, MAGICAL city. I would go back in a heartbeat. We were there for 2 days, and I think we covered most of the big sites and wandered enough to feel like we did what we wanted, but I wouldn't have turned down another day to just wander the streets, eat gelato, drink more wine and great food. I could give you a few names of places to go for great food, but there are SO MANY places and it's a little difficult to navigate, so I'd recommend just hitting the streets, wandering, and stopping wherever you think looks good...you won't be disappointed! (And encountering St. Mark's Square late at night will give you a big surprise - it floods! A couple inches, but it's a bittersweet reminder that the city of "elegant decay" really is sinking. Definitely added to the charm for us though!)

Reviews.Title: “Elegant boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christine189400
Reviews.Content: It was the best choice of hotel, I have done until now! Very close to San Marco & Rialto bridge.The superior double room -nr.203- was very elegant (the decorater had paid a lot of attention even to the smallest detail) & very spacious. Above all the hotel was brand new. In my opinion the fear of an old hotel with problems of humidity (bad smell) is the biggest one in this city. All 4 receptionists we meet were very polite & gave us very good advice on anything we asked for. A minor problem was the breakfast which was a bit basic (they must add fresh orange juice, cheese, ham & boiled eggs). I suggest this because for sure I will choose this hotel again next time I visit this dreamlike city!

Reviews.Title: “a success story”
Reviews.Author: AMBinkom
Reviews.Content: We know, itâ€™s quite boring because we keep repeating ourselves, but once again our stay at the Relais Venezia was just great. At our first visit to Venice, several years ago, we were lucky to discover a real treasure, the Locanda Sant Agostin, run by Federico and Leonardo. It was love at first sight. Since then the two brothers opened a second establishment in an other sestieri and in a different style, the Relais Venezia, but with all the success elements of the Locanda. Both establishments are charming, decorated in Venetian style, well kept, very clean and you feel immediately at home because a warm welcome awaits you on arrival. The two brothers do everything to make your stay a success. Last January we took our best friends to discover the most beautiful city in the World. We stayed two nights at the Relais. We were welcomed as old friends, were upgraded to the beautiful golden room with view on the orologia. Our friends were thrilled and are looking forward to returning. So Federico and Leonardo, thanks for another unforgettable visit. And â€¦ we will be back, thatâ€™s a promise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, in the Center of Venice”
Reviews.Author: SysTooL
Reviews.Content: Relais Hotel is a charming little hotel near Piazza San Marco (about 200 meters) - warning, Relais Venezia is not Relais Piazza San Marco Hotel... The rooms are very clean, arranged with taste, although a bit "cold". The personnel is nice and you can take your breakfast directly in your room. Price is quite expensive, but I'd say it's normal range for a nice, comfortable hotel in the center of Venezia

Reviews.Title: “You want a typical stay in Venice, choose this hotel !”
Reviews.Author: StevenLiegeBelgium
Reviews.Content: Being a pilot, I spend a lot of time in hotels wich are brandnew but unfortunately often without any charm. The Relais Venezia is the oposit: the hotel is modernised but hasn't lost his typical Venice-character, the staff is very friendly and makes you feel as if your are at home and all of this with all the modern comfort you need. Although there is a room to enjoy the breakfast, there is the oportunity to have it in your room and all this for free. Another big advantage of this hotel is the location: you are right in the very center of Venice near San Marco. Wandering through te city, I had a look at other hotels in order to check if I could find something better...I didn't! (at least not for the same price) If I go back to venice I will surely go back to this hotel! Steven,Belgium

Reviews.Title: “Magnify Venetian Charms”
Reviews.Author: ronacom13
Reviews.Content: We spent three days at the Relais Venetia at the end of March. The hotel is sequestered down a chain of streets and uniquely Venetian 'alleys' behind the busy San Marco square. So, while close to the epicenter of Venetian tourism, all within a 5 minute walk, the hotel feels less touristic and more intimate than other, larger, hotels. There are only ten rooms and one of the owners is usually visible. The two young owners, native Venetians, are charming, speak excellent English and offer their personal suggestions for non-touristy choices with great generosity. Breakfast is served in the elegantly transformed lobby with that same personal touch. Coffee and juices, yogurt and cereals are served with charm and generosity. The hotel is encapsulated in an old building totally redecorated and transformed within the last several years. There are signs of the age in the preserved ceiling beams and location, but the room are well furnished and comfortable with lush fabrics and fine materials. The baths, too, are modern and fully functional. All rooms, as well as the lobby, are on the second and third floors of the building, up a flight of marble steps or in a somewhat slow glass elevator (very handy with luggage!). We were given several restaurant suggestions by the owners that were wonderful, moderately priced and which we never would have found on our own. In fact, knowing my husband was interested in grappas, the hotel owner communicated this interest to the restaurant owner and we were surprised by a personal pouring at the conclusion of our dinner as a result. We have never experienced this degree of involvement at other places we've stayed at our previous visits to Venice. This made our stay feel very special.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: erkaIsrael
Reviews.Content: located in the center of everything, clean and new decorated, got a great recommendations for local restaurants, very nice bathroom, a modest breakfast (could be better..), a litttle expansive for the value (but it was the carnival time so the rates must have been higher)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: batflo
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 4 nights in this lovely little hotel - very clean with a helpful and accommodating staff, always at your disposal to provide guidance or assistance. One of the best thing about the hotel is the location. It is on a quiet side street but about 2 minutes walk to San Marco, less than 5 minutes walk to Rialto and in the middle of everywhere. I highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Not For Us”
Reviews.Author: shintair
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and comfortable, but we had a ground floor room which made us feel like we were staying in somebody's basement. It also seemed like they were trying to cover up how old things were getting by adding some fancier touches. The guy at the reception was trying to be friendly but it seemed forced (maybe he was just having a bad day, it was during carnevale time, but can't say for sure). The breakfast was the worst one we had on our whole trip to Italy. The location was great, but overall it wasn't woth the value we paid. This hotel may be right for others, but it is not one for us so we will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “my wifes 50th birthday”
Reviews.Author: gazzablade
Reviews.Content: For my wife:s 50th birthday we visited Venice for our first time .Our overall experience there was wonderful as was the hotel in which we stayed in .The Relais Venizia is in a perfect location for exploring all the sights in Venice and the staff were extremely helpful throughout our stay ,Dario organized a surprise bottle of wine for my wife in our room,told us the cheapest places to drink and booked us a table at a good restaurant. On our return to the airport, Dario also booked us a watertaxi to the airport which picked us up just outside the hotel .we paid 95 euros for this but was well worth it after the experience of the water bus.

Reviews.Title: “A getaway within a getaway!”
Reviews.Author: taimis
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel indeed, a getaway in the centre of Venice. Perfect location and the hotel is finished to a very high standard! Stayed at the silver room, I much preferred it to the blue decorated rooms so would advise to ask the staff for that particular room. Ordered the breakfast in the room which was very nice on the first morning, however we overslept it for the next to nights, I assume the staff did not want to knock too loud in case we were sleeping (which we were). So if you want to make sure you get your breakfast you should probably eat in the common area. Other than that, an great hotel, was very impressed, of course the price is not low, but then again Venice is very expensive anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: dieliebekati
Reviews.Content: We stayed in here for only 2 nights, but we would definitely come back. The staff is very friendly and helpful, the rooms are very clean and have such nice furniture and amazing bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Galvo1
Reviews.Content: We didn't choose this hotel, but the one we had booked emailed us to advise theyh had problems with their hydraulics and had to close for a few days. As it turns out Relais Venezia, the sister hotel, was very nice and in a better location than the original one we arranged. Overall, nice sized room, new bathroom fittings and good location. Staff were pleasant and breakfast was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value between San Marco & Rialto”
Reviews.Author: gerber99
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 302 which has a lovely view of the rooftops of Venice and the Alps (in the distance naturally). The room was clean and spacious and the breakfast more than adequate (cereal, yogurt, croissants, bread, coffee, tea, etc). The bathroom is functional (with shower and bidet), well-appointed and contemporary but may be a squeeze for someone larger. Leonardo and Federico were very helpful with recommending authentic restaurants in Venice and tips for our excursion to the nearby islands of Burano & Murano. The rest of the staff was friendly as well. Overall highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ina3040
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, nice furnished rooms, 3 minutes from St Marco. Good breakfast and very helpful people. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: iheartseptember
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights of our honeymoon. Great location was a quick walk to both Piazza San Marco and Ponte Rialto, but tucked away enough to be quiet. Relatively easy to find, especially for Venice, and especially using the very detailed directions that the hotel sends after you make your reservation. Front desk staff was helpful and friendly. Breakfast was nice, with fresh rolls or croissants, yogurts, juices, and cappuchino. Very friendly breakfast service in the main room, but they will also bring it to your room. We stayed in one of the blue and silver rooms, and it was comfortable and pretty, but fairly small. The fancy tub in the bathroom was great, though.

Reviews.Title: “Just The Spot”
Reviews.Author: SquiggerToronto
Reviews.Content: It was perfect for us. Right in the heart of Venice, short walks away from San Marco Square and Rialto Bridge. The service was very warm, friendly and helpful with directions, recommendations or reservations. The continental breakfast was great. The room was very spotless. We had a free wireless connection RIGHT in our room but that was because we were on the same floor as the checkin lobby. Getting there from Santa Lucia rail station was a little hectic because we used the public vaporetto...waiting to buy tickets, long ride on the Grand Canal, large luggage to haul because we had also been to Germany for over a week, and we got off at Valleresso stop with a long walk to the hotel...the one past it brings you closer. If you're not going to use public steamer a lot, just get the one-way ticket for 6.50 E per person, and pack lighter so you have an easier time getting to the hotel and carrying your luggage over the one bridge( stepped, so you have to carry). We took the water taxi back to Santa Lucia when leaving...it cost us 65E's. The hotel was perfect for us!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location for the price”
Reviews.Author: Tomscobra
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Large rooms for Venice. 5 minutes from the Doge piazza. Modern bath . Very small hotel only 5 or 6 rooms but would stay there again. Elevator and breakfast. Down a small alley off a main street, but hard to find in the rain Joanna

Reviews.Title: “quiet out of the way hotel yet very central”
Reviews.Author: vamanosNc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Relais Venezia mid-July. The hotel is only a 5 minute walk from Piazza San Marco but was tucked away on a quiet street (more like an alley). The rooms were clean and the bathrooms were newly remodeled. The shower had a handheld that you had to pick up to wash your hair. Our daughterâ€™s room on the second floor had a tub with a rainhead. There are no views from the rooms except the two on the very top floor. We had one of these rooms and a small window opened up to see the rooftops and the skylight gave you a view of the bell tower in Piazza San Marco. The hotel has only about 8 rooms so overall it is very quiet. Breakfast is a simple affair of coffee, tea, toast, cold cereal and yogurt. A nice touch is breakfast in the room if you ask for it the night before. The best part of the hotel is how central it was but just outside the tourist jammed streets around Piazza San Marco. The Rialto bridge was about a 10 minute walk and the main shopping streets were a 5-10 minute walk away. Our favorite thing to do was walk the streets in the evening after all the tour bus crowds had left. All the stores stayed open till 7PM and a fair number of them were open later. Walking around the Piazza San Marco and listening to the string quartets play was awesome as well. The restaurants were good but very expensive. In retrospect, I probably would have had more carry out pizza etc and just eaten in the room. For the money, the Relais Venezia is a very nice place to stay. Just donâ€™t let them put in the two lowest rooms as you will hear everybody coming in. Also, print out the map from the website as the place is a little tricky to find.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and location. Wonderful stay ;)”
Reviews.Author: _Mc_Zie_
Reviews.Content: We liked the place form the moment we found it (directions given by the hotel were very helpful and accurate). We stayed there for 5 days. Room was exactly the one I wanted and bottle of cold prosecco waiting for us (very good;). Breakfast was fullfilling - we found it big enough - helped us to survive till late dinner. Definately ask for restaurant recommendations - you won't be dissapointed - providing you will clarify what you are looking for (local, seafood etc.) - it will help staff to find something for you. Staff was really helpful - I couldn't find ANYthing I might have disliked about this place. GREAT STAY - it's really worth money spent on. I will definately book this place while in Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect :)”
Reviews.Author: royal_lady
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Relais Venezia as part of our honeymoon, we arrived at the hotel to find a spectacular little hotel, from the moment we arrived nothing was to much we stayed in the room just beside reception which we liked to call the "Winter Room" it was like something out of a Winter Wonderland. When we arrived altough the rooms were not quite ready(it was early) , we were happy to explore beautiful Venice. The staff were so helpful at giving directions, recommendfind ing things to see and do. We came back to the hotel that afternoon to our suitcases in our rooms and a bottle of Proscecco waiting. We awoke the next morning to the smell of croissants..yummy breakfast was served to us in our room each morning by friendly , smiling staff. We loved the hotel and would recommend it to everyone. Beautiful hotel in a beautiful city..will def be back

Reviews.Title: “Great, Quiet, Central Location at Relaiz Venezia”
Reviews.Author: cm8dj6
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Relais Venezia in April. Our room was small with 2 singles & on the front desk floor, but amazingly quiet & dark at night so we got a good nights sleep. The room was super clean & we were worried about no wi-fi, but Fredericko set us up with their internet connection everyday with our computer (we were blogging our trip). There was also an internet place around the corner. The hotel was hard to find at first, but once there, it was about a 3 minute walk to San Marco & 10 minutes to Rialto. Our niece met us for 4 nights & stayed in a very large superior room up one floor with a couch & large bed & huge tub. She loved it. Fredericko & Ricardo (2 brothers) were more than happy to help us. Breakfast was OK, croissant, roll, cereal, tea, espresso hot choc, yogurt - same everyday, but no worries for us. We booked a month in advance & paid 140 euros a night cash at the end of our stay. We recommended the hotel to a couple we met on the Cinque Terre trail who were having a hard time booking at the last minute. Hope they got in!

Reviews.Title: “very clean & smart decoration”
Reviews.Author: GALICIAesUNICA
Reviews.Content: It was a very nice surprise to find a such a good value hotel placed in the city center, just a few steps from Plaza San Marcos. Hotels in Venecia use to has very low quality But NoT "Relais Venezia" which is a wonderfull place to enjoy a romantic weekend!! it looks like a 4 stars hotel (chic bathrooms and smart decoration). the recepcionist staff were very kind and helpfull. Definitely I recommend this hotel!! THANK YOU

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service was OUTSTANDING”
Reviews.Author: trb130
Reviews.Content: Rooms were spacious and clean; Service was OUTSTANDING especially for those of us who did not speak Italian and were "lost" with travel information (Water Taxis, Trains) Quite pricy for Americans, however so is all of Eurpoe in these times. I would definately stay at this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: sassyc54
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel easily following the instructions and we were not disappointed when we arrived. The decor is lovely and the staff were helpful and attentive. Our room was so pretty in silver and blue and the bathroom was modern and fresh. A very comfortable bed gave us a good night's sleep. Breakfast was plentiful and the coffee provided a good caffeine fix for the day. Only a moment's walk from St. Mark's Square and do ask at reception for restaurant recommendations - they will show you some that the locals use and are better value than the tourist places.

Reviews.Title: “Venice hideaway”
Reviews.Author: ptb52
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this lovely small hotel during our two-day stay in Venice in early October 2008. The location is excellent--easy walking distance from Piazza San Marco. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful with restaurant suggestions and directions to different sites. The breakfast served in our room was a delicious and luxurious treat for weary travelers. Spotlessly clean room and modern bathroom with nice towels and bath products.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, fabulous find”
Reviews.Author: discerning17
Reviews.Content: A wonderful find and one of the loveliest boutique hotels that we have ever stayed at! Firstly it's location is amazing, being just a short stroll away(.....say 5 mins) from St Mark's Square, Rialto and the best Venetian restaurants and shops. The hotel itself was wonderfully run and immaculately kept. It's enchanting interior design, being the perfect marriage of great contemporary taste and classically traditional furnishings. Best of all was the helpful and warm fine local knowledge offered by the staff. E.g. the best (though not necessarily most expensive) local restaurants, things to do and see etc The upper rooms are beautifully quiet. We will return in the near future and have been highly recommending this lovely place to many of our friends

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, wonderful hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: FluffyCostaBlanca
Reviews.Content: We visited the Relais Venezia on October 9th for 3 nights I have been to Venice several times over the last few years but have never stayed this close to the centre. It was the first time I had taken my husband so I wanted it to be special but not too expensive! I spent days looking at hotels on the internet and was delighted to find the Relais Venezia so close to St Marks. I was very anxious as the price seemed too reasonable and wasn't sure what the standard would be like. We found it very easily and it was even closer to St Marks Square that I thought. The staff was extremely courteous and helpful and the room was immaculate. We were given the option of having breakfast brought to our room, free of charge which was wonderful. I will definitely return to the Relais next time I return to Venice as it is great value for money and close to all the sights. It was extremely quiet at the hotel yet within 2 mins you in the middle of St Marks Square. An incredible place and thank you for an amazing short break,

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Away_8
Reviews.Content: Excellent location near San Marco Sq. Very friendly, helpful staff. Breakfast in bed great. Bed comfortable. Get a reduction on the price if you pay cash on arrival rather than paying with credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel in a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: vigo152
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in the Relais Venezia and all we can say is that it was definitely one of our favorite hotels in all of Italy!! The hotel is location a few blocks behind the Piazza San Marco. It is quite a modern hotel but with such classic touches! The rooms are decorated absolutely stunning with gorgeous drapings and cool fixtures. Our room had a flat screen tv which was great! The bathroom was a one-of-a-kind. . .It was really nice, sheek, and modern with uplighting on the bathtub. The room and bathroom were spotless and very comfortable. The hotel itself was beautiful and the staff was very friendly. Everyone provided us with great recommendations and tips on getting around the town. Breakfast was very good serving fruits, yogurts, bread, and coffee/cappuchino/tea. The great part of this hotel is its location. It is close to everything . . . a few blocks from the Piazza San Marco, Grand Canal, Ponte di Rialto. Even better was the fact that there was a market a few doors down. We ran out of toothpaste so I was able to get it there as well as other goods (bread, sodas, water, etc.). We highly recommend this hotel to all of our friends and family. We will definitely be returning to Venice and when we do. . . you can bet that we will be staying at the Relais Venezia again! Tip 1: Before your arrival to Venice, definitely ask the hotel staff to give you detailed directions on getting to hotel. It was a little confusing in getting to the hotel (especially when you are carrying luggages) so we did get a little lost. Then again, you are always lost in the streets of Venice! Tip 2: Throw out your map and get lost in the streets of Venice! Exploring the town is the fun part of this city!!

Reviews.Title: “2nd Visit.....”
Reviews.Author: Doreen65
Reviews.Content: I first visited in March 2008 on a short break with my sisters, and the Relais Venezia accomodated us extremely well. Our room -202- was comfortable although with an extra bed the floor space was a bit cramped. We found hanging our clothes in the extremely tall wardrobe with the hooked pole was hilarious as all of us are quite short!! The staff were all extremely helpful and the continental breakfast was perfectly adequate with delicious coffee. My second visit in September was with my husband for a romantic break. Again we were given room 202 and without the extra bed the room was more than adequate and the bathroom is extremely well fitted. The positioning of the hotel is perfect for the tourist - just a few minutes walk to all the major sights of St Marks Square and the Rialto bridge, but tucked away from the noise that tourists bring. Venice is perfect for all types of visits from sightseeing to people watching - and jumping from one vaporetto to another without knowing where you will end up only adds to the pleasure. I would recommend Venice, the hotel and its staff to anybody Doreen - Essex England

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: SNF40
Reviews.Content: Beautiful botique hotel just around a few bends from St Marcs square and also not far from the Rialto bridge. The staff where definately one of the highlights and as mentioned I am sure the gentleman that looked after us was an owner as he was incredibly helpful and passionate about Venice and his advice on what was worthwhile and what was not about the sites to see! The rooms are very well presented and the bathroom very nice as well. For the cost I cannot think of much better value for money all things considered in a city such as Venice!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: yello_jello
Reviews.Content: We were so pleased to find this hotel. It was just what we wanted: brilliantly clean, amazing location and very, very cool! It was sweltering outside and it was such a relief to drag ourselves back to the hotel and switch on the air-con. We actually had the ground floor room and loved it. I am a light sleeper and wasn't woken by people coming in and out, plus it felt really private being away from the reception area and meant we could easily roll into bed on return from our sight-seeing! The only thing I would mention is not to get your hopes up about the breakfast: it is functional rather than anything special. But all in all it was a really good hotel with great staff who could recommend proper restaurants rather than tourist traps!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: VPGloucestershire
Reviews.Content: Fantastic boutique style hotel.just a few minutes walk from St Marks. We stayed for 4 nights. The rooms are decorated in a modern style with an antique twist. Spotlessly clean. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Would certainly return and recommend to anyone looking for an hotel in central Venice. V & P Gloucestershire

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent find”
Reviews.Author: YorkDavid
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family of 5 in this excellent boutique hotel, so close to St Marks square it was easy to pop around the corner, for a coffee whilst others were still having a siesta! Venice is such a lovely City, and staying in the heart of the city added greatly to its charm. The rooms are simply and stylishly furnished, and the staff were very friendly and attentive making you feel much more like welcome guests, rather than a tourist. Previous reviews have commented on the somewhat limited choice of breakfast, but what the Relais Venezia may lack in choice, it more than makes up with it in style, earning it high accolades from all the family. The Relais Venezia will certainly become our future base in Venice. One tip would be to take a water taxis from the airport, - they can drop you off at the adjacent canal, and is well worth the 80 euros to ensure we quickly located the hotel. Once found, it was easy traveling from nearby water bus stops at St Marks Sq

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel in San Marco”
Reviews.Author: JJ_Orlando_FL
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at this wonderful boutique hotel, just 2 minutes walk from Piazza di San Marco. Located on a quiet side street just off one of the main walkways from San Marco to the Rialto, it has 12 beautifully appointed rooms. A continental breakfast is served in the (small) lounge or, at no additional charge, in your room. The staff were very friendly and knowledgeable and made us feel very welcome. Everything you need is close by: a supermarket, restaurants, gondola rides -- even a laundrette. An internet cafe is just around the corner. We would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: nhodge
Reviews.Content: A bit of a "boutique" hotel; only 10 rooms, and typical European size (which doesn't bother me at all). Just by their behavior, I would guess that some of the desk staff were the owners. Even if not, still has the feel of a small operation. i.e., quite friendly. Pros: * Location: Can walk quickly to Piazza San Marco, but far enough away to avoid all of the negative spillover, and off of the beaten path. * Building: Renovated to a fairly high standard, including both decor and quality. * Staff: All very friendly, and helpful. * Cost: Not too expensive; we paid about â‚¬100 per person per night. * Extras: Very nice continental breakfasts, and A/C works great! Cons: * Only serious one is that some of the staff does not really speak English, which makes it difficult to do things like get directions. As the subject says, overall, excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: prinsc
Reviews.Content: Lovely boutique hotel with only seven or eight rooms, in a quiet alley literally a couple of minutes from from Piazza San Marco. It is recently renovated building with lots of upscale modern touches (flat screen TVs, dream bathrooms, and creative lighting, etc.) The staff was very friendly and were quick to offer advice, but the location is what makes this a great value. In addition to being steps from the Piazza San Marco, there is a internet cafe within 50 ft. and a grocery store across the corner (you'll soon realize how nice that is!!). I was a little skeptical booking online at what was the lowest rate for a three star hotel in Venice, but the place was magnificent. Next time in Venice, I would not look anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the ratings”
Reviews.Author: jhcUk
Reviews.Content: Great value and in a very good position. It's situated in a quiet lane but only a few minutes from St Marks. Equally it's only a short walk to the Rialto Bridge. We stayed in the loft room with views over the rooftops of Venice - to be recommended. The room was a reasonable size - comfortable and clean with quality furnishings which give the place an air of a 4* hotel. A good bathroom - modern and newly decorated. A decent continental breakfast and they'll offer you as much tea, coffee, rolls & croissants as you want. Cereals and yoghurts too. Very helpful staff for restaurants and places to see. They have someone on call 24 hrs. We reserved direct on line with CC but when you check out they'll offer you a discount if you pay by cash so be prepared - it's worth it (they have to pay quite a lot on CC charges so they'll pass on the saving if you pay by cash) We stayed for 3 nights and wouldn't hesitate to recommended it for the price, compared to other places in Venice. Drawbacks? Only the fact that there are a few flights of stairs to get to the room (the lift only goes to the first floor) but that is very typical of these sorts of atmospheric properties in Venice. It would only be an inconvenince for the very old and should not put you off.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: kayzebonda56
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after scouring all the hotels in Venice - this definitely had the best reviews for the money. The hotel was really lovely in a good location just 2 minutes from St Marks Square and 4 minutes from the Rialto Bridge. Our room was excellent as was the bathroom. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Hello to Kai and Andy - hope you had a good honeymoon and sorry we didn't see you to say 'goodbye'!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: meluvgnocchi
Reviews.Content: I am very nervous when it comes to booking hotels as I know they can make or break a trip. This hotel completely lived up to it's high rating on TripAdvisor. It was smack in the middle of Venice, exceptionally clean, well designed and the staff were inordinately helpful and friendly - everything we could have asked for. If you are looking for a nice, small, quiet, mid to upper range hotel in Venice - this is a great place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Desfordtraveller
Reviews.Content: We visited for 5 nights. The hotel is ideally situated between the Rialto Bridge and St Marks Square. The hotel is modern, clean and well run. All the staff were friendly and spoke good english. They were able to recommend attractions to visit and restaurants. The rooms were well furnished with TV, fridge, safe and air con. There are no tea making facilities so take a travel kettle if you want a drink. Breakfast was a basic continental one but you could eat as much as you want. They are happy to serve breakfast in your room at no extra cost. As with most hotels in Venice it is not easy to find so follow instructions carefully. There is a good bar under the hotel called the Planet bar - they show football and you can eat and drink there until quite late.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and helpful...”
Reviews.Author: AylesburyItaly_Fan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a weekend and found the rooms nicely decorated and modern. It is a small bed and breakfast style hotel but is none the less run very professionally and all staff were very helpful with good knowledge of English. Highly reccommended for anyone wishing to stay near St Marks square without paying the earth.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: johannamaria
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little hotel. The location is perfect. I would only recommend it to people who like small hotels with no services. There is no lounge, the breakfast room is not well heated and they don't even turn on all the lights. The room (superior) was tastefully designed but somewhat uncomfortable: No chair, no sofa, no light for reading. The small bathroom is very pretty. Breakfast is basic, but the waitress is nice and helpful. If you can get a good price the place is allright.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, clean, large rooms”
Reviews.Author: tigerbo7
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is a perfect place to stay in Venice, quaint, clean, modern and close to everything. So perfect.....I can't say it enough. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was spectacular with a giant tub. We would open our window in the morning to the neighbours singing next door....so wonderful. Safe and quiet. Continental breakfast included...but get there early as the dining area is petite but the coffee exceptional. We will visit Venice again....fantastic. So easy to get away from the crowds in Venice and a wonderful cafe and gallery on every corner. You must also visit the Lido and ride bikes around the island...feels a little like California on the Lido...very different than Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: EireGlitter!
Reviews.Content: Just back from a trip to Italy which included Venice. The Relais Venezia was a fab little hotel located 3 minutes walk from st marks square. We arrived early for check in and were delighted our room was ready. after being in the room 5 minutes there was a knock on our door and we got 2 glasses of champange which was such a lovely touch. Room was spotlessly clean as well as bathroom with a LCD tv on wall. We got our breakfast to our room each morning free of charge which was a selection of pastries, yogart, coffee etc. there is a small breakfast area situated in the reception area. The staff were lovely and friendly and helped us with any queries we had. Would defo go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised !”
Reviews.Author: Ferien101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Relais Venezia 3 nights in July 2007 in a quadruple room on the 3rd or 4th floor. The view was wonderful - rooftops of Venice and you could hear the bells from St. Mark's square. Our room had one large (king-size) bed and two twins for the kids. Room had A/C and a small fridge which was nice to keep drinks and snacks cool. The bathroom was small, but very modern and clean. It had a tub (no separate shower) without shower curtain which seems to be standard in most Italian hotels. Housekeeping was very efficient, our room was cleaned daily by the time we came back in the early afternoon and there were plenty of clean towels. We really enjoyed the complimentary breakfast in the small reception/breakfast area. It consisted of fresh rolls, jams, croissants, juice, and I think also some cereal. The cappucino was delicious! The lady serving the breakfast was so kind, always offering refills. They also serve breakfast in the room, if requested. The staff was friendly and accomodating and they all spoke some English. The location was great, easy to reach all major attractions.

HotelInfo.Name: Relais Venezia
HotelInfo.Address: Castello 5285, 30122 Venice, Italy
